reviews.review:
Por enquanto joguei até o quinto capitulo e afirmo que esse jogo é melhor que o episódio 1 e tem o mesmo nível do HL 2, muito divertido, história se desenvolve muito bem e tem umas trilhas sonoras de arrepiar! (editarei essa review quando zerar)

Um dia depois, finalmente zerei e cara... que final tenebroso. Não dizendo que tem um final ruim, mas sim triste, fiquei pensativo depois de zerar, ainda mais sabendo que a continuação vai lançar dia 30/02/2077.
Não tem mais o que adicionar ali, o jogo não tem quase nenhum defeito, história jogabilidade soundtrack, tudo excelente, tão bom quanto o HL 1 e o 2, GOTY.
10/10
now im depressed because no half life 3

Very very fun. But I do have some problems with the game. (in every half life 2 game I've played) I hear the head-crab sound affect even if I'm not near a head-crab or in a zombie level, very short game for a half life game, very long unskipable boring cut scenes, (personal problem with the game) and I got all hidden cobwebs and killed very little creature and I still didn't get the achievement.

Other than those, I had so much fun playing the game. Same as the other half life 2 games, very fun, always has a very fun stand off mission, always has a very fun zombie part of the game, and always has long boring cut scenes that are very long.

8.9/10 would recommend.
Now I get why everybody wants Half Life 3 to come out

Словами передать нельзя, сколько ностальгии я испытываю... По той эпохе игровых проектов, и как говорил Кляйнер, ГРАНТ и ЗЛАТО, всегда, повторюсь, ВСЕГДА, ВО ВСЁМ, ВСЕ ВРЕМЕНА, даже после старческих лет, даже наши дети, внуки, правнуки, испытают то чувство, что испытывал я со своим отцом. Эх, это были мои любимые воспоминания, мой папа тогда чуть ли не каждого врага валил наповал) я был тогда малым, не зрелым и глупым ребёнком.. Но спустя столько лет... Если уж 3 ему эпизоду не выйти на свет, что ж. 
Я благодарен Гейбу Ньюелу, благодарен ВСЕЙ ЕГО КОМАНДЕ, ВСЕМ И КАЖДОМУ ОЛДАФАГУ, СПАСИБО, ЧТО ИГРАЕТЕ В ЭТО, СПАСИБО ЧТО ПОМНИТЕ, ПОМНИТЕ И ИГРАЕТЕ.
Этот шутер будет ВЕЧНО ЖИТЬ В НАШИХ СЕРДЦАХ, В КАЖДОМ ИЗ НАС. 
Half Life! ЗЛАТО И ПЛАТИНА ВСЕХ ШУТЕРОВ  ПРОШЕДШИХ ЛЕТ.
Если вы это читаете, значит вы истинный ценитель данной серии. 
Спасибо за внимание.

Half-Life 2: Episode Two is the culmination of Valve's storytelling, level design, and gameplay. This second expansion surpasses the base game in everything but length. There is a reason so many have anxiously hoped for the next Half-Life and that reason is Half-Life 2: Episode Two.

PROS:
- Some of the best level design in any Valve game, perhaps surpassed only by the Portal games
- The unique weapons and enemies from the base game with a few interesting additions
- Great visuals and art direction
- Great storytelling with compelling characters and plot
- Solid performance with no bugs encountered

CONS:
- Early levels are not the best
- Fairly short

Man, I loved Half-Life 1, hated Half-Life 2 and more or less liked Half-Life 2: Episode One.
Having played Half-Life 2: Episode Two, I'm wondering: why wasn't the main game done as well as this one?

As some point out, Half-Life 2 feels like a tech demo. But this episode: it is great. A lot more dialogue, a lot less filler content, more action and cool fight scenes with cool fight music.
Only in this episode I finally felt like a badass Ph.D with a crowbar. I only wish all episodes were like this one. Like, recommend to play if you didn't love the main Half-Life 2.

As for the cliffhanger: well, yea. it IS there. But playing this in 2022 does not feel like "Oh my god! What's gonna be next?!", because the story is [i]paused[/i] at a more or less "semicolon". It is not the end, but it definitely isn't abrupted. Considering that Half-Life: Alyx was done, we still might get the third part. Maybe on VR, maybe on Steam Deck, maybe some kind of hybrid. Valve won't run forever.

Doctorrr Freemmannnn.

If you have reached it this far I tip my hat off to you. You have truly imbued yourself deep within the legend and lore that is the Half-Life universe and the symbolic and mythical status that surrounds the Freeman. 

Think of it like this, we all started this journey in 1998 and now we are in 2022. Along the way, in more ways than one, the significance of this game, its infamy and its influence on us all,  has completed in my opinion a truly perplexing, pensive and trans-mundane effect on the Pysche.

Half-Life 2 episode Two released in 2007,  is a sight that is to be behold. The journey of the Freeman continues outside City 17 in the wilderness, escaping the remnants of the multidimensional combine overlords and the resonating shadows of Black Mesa. 

Episode 2 is known in gaming as one of the most cliff hanging ends. Still to this day 15 year later, answers remain unchanged. Im sure that if you have invested this much time, you have heard the rumors about the cancellations of Episode 3, Half-Life 3 being a mere myth like the Greek gods of old and now just recently the surprising release of Alyx in VR.

Regardless of how much info is given during this story and how far advanced we get, so many unanswered questions remain. Characters like the infamous G-man and his unexplaiaible, inexplicable and interfering speeches are the very testament of vexation and bewilderment. It just continues to build and build, including those anecdotes and words said by other characters, actions conducted by foes, complete and intertwine one of the greatest untold stories.

There are merely no other words to be said. This is a must and crucial game within the series, but it may leave you in a pondering thought that many of us have been sitting in for 15 years. But to the dismay of many, all of us clutching to the light at the end of a tunnel somewhere in highway 17, Valve is simply not done here. They know of the question we ask and only they can deliver. it

To posterity.
